overview_of_class:
This beginning level jazz dance course focuses on dancing rhythmically - using jazz rhythms and the syncopated rhythms of rock-based music like funk and hip hop to generate all dance movement. The concept of "full-bodied rhythm-making" guides this goal. It involves, first, singing the rhythms of the movement and, second, turning the extremities of the body - the hands, head, and feet - into "drumbeaters" that strike these rhythms against the "drumheads" of both the floor and the space around the body.

The alignment concept called Standing Down Straight® gives both stability and relaxation to the body as it makes rhythms. Rather than work from an uplifted posture and/or leg turn-out to achieve verticality, standing down straight grounds the body by letting the bones "sit" in response to the pull of gravity. From this loose and powerful base, high-energy, percussive rhythm-making can occur without causing strain or injury to the body.
name: Jump Rhythm Technique 1
subject: DANCE
